Timothy Goodman was filmed without his consent and became the subject of a viral TikTok video.
The viral video about Timothy Goodman received over a million views before it was removed.
Nonplayer characters (NPCs) are people in online content who are not seen as fully realized individuals and are simply part of the backdrop.

Jenna Drenten is an associate professor who studies digital consumer culture, and she mentions that we are living in a self-induced surveillance state where everyone is constantly filming and surveilling.
When a video goes viral on TikTok, it can gain a massive audience and become popular for a moment in time.
Mark Bartholomew says that it is generally legal to film and photograph people in public without their permission.
The issue with Harrison Pawluk's viral TikTok video was that he filmed a woman without her consent, turning it into a self-serving act of kindness for his own content.
Sarah Isenberg felt uncomfortable and unnerved when she was unknowingly filmed in someone else's vlog without her consent.
Lilly Simon experienced cyberbullying and received mocking comments after being filmed on the subway without her consent.
Content like Pawluk's aims to elevate the creator as the hero of the story, gaining attention and views at the expense of others.
